lexeme.note: Prob. denominative from the word for "three" -> "plough three times"
Adj. probably from unattested verbal root *š-t-y

semantics.meaning: sickle (?) or similar agricultural cutting implement

lexeme.note: Loan from Hurrian (itself based on Akkadian borrowed root for "bronze")

semantics.meaning: Possibly "boar", or perh. an unrelated Hurrian-derived military title

language.name: Old Testament Hebrew
language.alternative-names: Hebrew, Biblical Hebrew, Classical Hebrew, Ancient Hebrew, Old Hebrew

word-list.name: Culture words for old Middle-Eastern non-IE

source.full-citation: del Olmo Lete, G.D. & Sanmartín, J. (2004). Handbuch der Orientalistik. Abt. 1, Der Nahe und Mittlere Osten = The Near and Middle East. Bd 67, A dictionary of the Ugaritic language in the alphabetic tradition. P. 1, [⁾(a/i/u)-k]. (2. rev. ed.) Leiden: Brill.
Ola Wikander, Th.D. & Lecturer at the Centre for Theology and Religious Studies, Lund University.
Köhler, L. & Baumgarter, W. (2001). The Hebrew and Aramaic lexicon of the Old Testament (translated and edited under the supervision of M.E.J. Richardson). Leiden: Brill.
Brown, F., Driver, S.R. & Briggs, C.A. (2000). The Enhanced Brown-Driver-Briggs Hebrew and English Lexicon. Peabody, Mass.: Hendrickson.
Botterweck, G.J. & Ringgren, H. (red.) (1974-). Theological dictionary of the Old Testament. Grand Rapids, Mich.: Eerdmans.
